results.title: Theory of flight
results.brief_description: Wind tunnel tests demonstrate the relation between air velocity and lift and drag on plain and cambered air-foils; control of aeroplane movements about vertical, lateral, and longitudinal axes by means of rudder, elevator, and ailerons respectively, are demonstrated.
results.description: Wind tunnel tests demonstrate the relation between air velocity and lift and drag on plain and cambered air-foils; control of aeroplane movements about vertical, lateral, and longitudinal axes by means of rudder, elevator, and ailerons respectively, are demonstrated.

results.title: Theories on the origin of life
results.creator_credit: Bert Van Bork and Encyclopaedia Britannica Educational Corporation
results.brief_description: This presentation of four theories on the origin of life is designed to promote discussion and lead to research. The theory of “special creation” attributes the origin of life to a supernatural being; the theory of spontaneous generation proposes that life originated from inorganic materials; while the cosmozic theory suggests that life on earth originated elsewhere in the universe. The final theory introduced is the now commonly accepted theory of evolution. Equal emphasis is given to each theory to encourage students to discuss the evidence on which the theories are based.

results.title: Theorem = Teorema
results.creator_credit: Pier Pasolini, Manolo Bolognini, Franco Rossellini and Argos Films
results.brief_description: The story is simple - a mysterious stranger (Terence Stamp) arrives at a bourgeois household in Milan and successively seduces the son (Andres Jose Cruz), the mother (Silvana Magnano), the daughter (Anne Wiazemsky) and the father (Massimo Girotti), not forgetting the maid (Laura Betti). As a result of his attentions, the father hands over his factory to the workers, the son abandons his vocation as a painter, the mother gives herself over to random sexual encounters and the daughter sinks into catatonia while the maid becomes a saint. Pasolini uses his schematic plot to prove a point (the bourgeois family is held together by sexual repression) and to explore family dynamics, the intersection of class and sex, and the nature of different sexualities. He also delves into the ‘trouble’ caused by homosexuality. In Italian with English subtitles.

results.title: Theodora
results.brief_description: Theodora, an oratorio in three parts, music by George Frideric Handel with Libretto by Thomas Morell, is a tale of virtuous love bound for tragic consequences in the name of Christian martyrdom during 4th century Roman occupied Antioch (Syria) under the reign of the Roman Emperor Diocletian. However, what is so different with this portrayal of Theodora is the way internationally renowned director Peter Sellars has set the story in modern day America including the final chilling scene of martyrdom being represented by Theodora and Didymus’s execution by lethal injection. The stark stage setting is evocative with its lighting and shadows and manages to create the desired moods of emotion and drama. A powerful performance by Dawn Upshaw as Theodora, strong and yet sensitive, and an equally excellent performance by David Daniels as Didymus. Supporting cast includes Frode Olsen (Valens), Richard Croft (Septimius), Lorraine Hunt (Irene) and Michael Hart-Davis (Messenger). Also features the Orchestra of the Age of Enlightenment conducted by William Christie, with musical direction by Andrew Davis and accompanied by the Glyndebourne Chorus (chorus master Christopher Moulds). This made for television production of “Theodora” was performed at the 1996 Glyndebourne Festival Opera. Sung in English with English subtitles.

results.title: Theobald faces the facts
results.creator_credit: Cal Dunn, Joe Betzer and Cal Dunn Studios
results.brief_description: An animated cartoon which presents facts that reveal the inaccuracy of mythical fancies concerning the effects of alcoholic beverages. The film technique used is designed for audience participation.

results.title: Then one year
results.brief_description:
Deals primarily with physiological changes in boys and girls at the onset of adolescence, and also to some extent with the worries and tensions of that period. Stresses that individual differences are normal variants.
Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Then and Now
results.brief_description: Recounts the story of the Gaganja tribe and of an Aboriginal elder’s experience of white people entering his land.It compares the early conflict of settlement with the situation in Australia today. Winner of the category “Create a moving image stamp story” An animated short entered to “Create a Stamp Story” section of ACMI’s ‘Screen It’ media making competition for Primary Schools.

results.title: Theme development in movement education (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Glenn Kirchner and Burbank Audio Visual
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Movement Education”.
Begins with a brief explanation of how to plan a short theme in a progressive and systematic way. In the second part, an extended theme of matching shapes is developed with a fourth grade class through a series of nine lessons. Shows excellent use of small and large equipment

results.title: Them!
results.creator_credit: Gordon Douglas, David Weisbart and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: Man split the atom to create the ultimate weapon not realising he would also create Them! The terror begins in the New Mexico desert when a patrolman (James Whitmore) discovers a ransacked General Store with the cash drawers untouched, the sugar supply missing and a battered corpse containing enough formic acid to kill 20 men. An FBI official and a fuddy-duddy entomologist (Edmund Gwenn) attempt to unravel the mystery. What they discover strikes terror from coast to coast: man’s atomic testing has spawned rampaging hordes of giant radiation-mutated ants, 12 feet long and capable of lifting tons. These mutants bypass the larval stage and come directly from the egg - ready to kill. In an epic death struggle, the formidable formicidae are trapped in the 700-mile storm drain network beneath fear-stricken Los Angeles and eventually beaten. A generation of films about radioactive creatures have approximated the terror but none have equalled the artistry of Them! with Academy Award nominated special effects (1954). Co-starring Joan Weldon, James Arness and Onslow Stevens. Fess Parker has a small but memorable role and look quickly for Leonard Nimoy at a teletype machine.
